019
020package org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer;
021
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023
024import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
025import javax.lang.model.element.Modifier;
026import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
027import java.lang.reflect.Type;
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.Optional;
030
031import org.apiguardian.api.API;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal.TypeSpecImpl;
034
035/**
036 *  The specification of a generated class, interface, annotation or enum
037 *  declaration.
038 *
039 *  @author Square,Inc.
040 *  @modified   Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
041 *  @version $Id: TypeSpec.java 1085 2024-01-05 16:23:28Z tquadrat $
042 *  @since 0.0.5
043 *
044 *  @UMLGraph.link
045 */
046@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: TypeSpec.java 1085 2024-01-05 16:23:28Z tquadrat $" )
047@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
048public sealed interface TypeSpec
049    permits TypeSpecImpl
050{
051        /*---------------*\
052    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
053        \*---------------*/
054    /**
055     *  The specification for a builder for an instance of an implementation
056     *  for
057     *  {@link TypeSpec}.
058     *
059     *  @author Square,Inc.
060     *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
061     *  @version $Id: TypeSpec.java 1085 2024-01-05 16:23:28Z tquadrat $
062     *  @since 0.0.5
063     *
064     *  @UMLGraph.link
065     */
066    @SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyMethods", "InnerClassOfInterface"} )
067    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: TypeSpec.java 1085 2024-01-05 16:23:28Z tquadrat $" )
068    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
069    public static interface Builder
070    {
071            /*---------*\
072        ====** Methods **======================================================
073            \*---------*/
074        /**
075         *  <p>{@summary Adds an annotation for the type to build.}</p>
076         *  <p>Do not use this method to add a
077         *  {@link SuppressWarnings &#64;SuppressWarnings}
078         *  annotation to the type; instead use
079         *  {@link #addSuppressableWarning(SuppressableWarnings...)}
080         *  to add the warning to suppress.</p>
081         *  <p>The annotation will be generated automatically when the type is
082         *  finally build.</p>
083         *
084         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding an annotation.
085         *
086         *  @param  annotationSpec  The annotation.
087         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
088         */
089        public Builder addAnnotation( final AnnotationSpec annotationSpec );
090
091        /**
092         *  <p>{@summary Adds an annotation for the type to build.}</p>
093         *  <p>Do not use this method to add a
094         *  {@link SuppressWarnings &#64;SuppressWarnings}
095         *  annotation to the type; instead use
096         *  {@link #addSuppressableWarning(SuppressableWarnings...)}
097         *  to add the warning to suppress.</p>
098         *  <p>The annotation will be generated automatically when the type is
099         *  finally build.</p>
100         *
101         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding an annotation.
102         *
103         *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
104         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
105         */
106        public Builder addAnnotation( final Class<?> annotation );
107
108        /**
109         *  <p>{@summary Adds an annotation for the type to build.}</p>
110         *  <p>Do not use this method to add a
111         *  {@link SuppressWarnings &#64;SuppressWarnings}
112         *  annotation to the type; instead use
113         *  {@link #addSuppressableWarning(SuppressableWarnings...)}
114         *  to add the warning to suppress.</p>
115         *  <p>The annotation will be generated automatically when the type is
116         *  finally build.</p>
117         *
118         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding an annotation.
119         *
120         *  @param  annotation  The annotation.
121         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
122         */
123        public Builder addAnnotation( final ClassName annotation );
124
125        /**
126         *  <p>{@summary Add the given annotations for the type to build.}</p>
127         *  <p>Do not use this method to add a
128         *  {@link SuppressWarnings &#64;SuppressWarnings}
129         *  annotation to the type; instead use
130         *  {@link #addSuppressableWarning(SuppressableWarnings...)}
131         *  to add the warning to suppress.</p>
132         *  <p>The annotation will be generated automatically when the type is
133         *  finally build.</p>
134         *
135         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding an annotation.
136         *
137         *  @param  annotationSpecs The annotations.
138         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
139         */
140        public Builder addAnnotations( final Iterable<AnnotationSpec> annotationSpecs );
141
142        /**
143         *  <p>{@summary Adds an attribute to this type.}</p>
144         *  <p>An attribute is basically a field with the related accessor and
145         *  mutator methods.</p>
146         *  <p>If the name for a non-final property will be {@code text}, and
147         *  its type is {@code java.lang.String}, the generated code will look
148         *  basically like this:</p>
149         *  <pre><code>  …
150         *  private String m_Text;
151         *  …
152         *  public final String text() { return m_Text; }
153         *  …
154         *  public final void text( final String value ) { m_Text = text; }
155         *  …</code></pre>
156         *  <p>If accessor or mutator needs to be more complex, the respective
157         *  methods must be created manually.</p>
158         *
159         *  @note The name of the mutator parameter is always {@code value}; if
160         *      this is also the name of the field, the generated code will not
161         *      compile. In this case, the mutator has to be generated
162         *      manually, too.
163         *
164         *  @param  fieldSpec   The field definition.
165         *  @param  readOnly    {@code true} if no mutator should be created
166         *      even for a non-final field, {@code false} if a mutator has to
167         *      be created for a non-final field. Will ignored if the field is
168         *      final.
169         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
170         *
171         *  @since 0.2.0
172         */
173        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
174        public Builder addAttribute( final FieldSpec fieldSpec, boolean readOnly );
175
176        /**
177         *  Adds an {@code enum} constant for the type to build.
178         *
179         *  @param  name    The name for the {@code enum} constant.
180         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
181         */
182        public Builder addEnumConstant( final CharSequence name );
183
184        /**
185         *  Adds an {@code enum} constant for the type to build.
186         *
187         *  @param  name    The name for the {@code enum} constant.
188         *  @param  javaDoc The code block for the Javadoc for this
189         *      {@code enum} constant.
190         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
191         */
192        public Builder addEnumConstant( final CharSequence name, final CodeBlock javaDoc );
193
194        /**
195         *  Adds an {@code enum} constant for the type to build.
196         *
197         *  @param  name    The name for the {@code enum} constant.
198         *  @param  format  The format for the Javadoc for this {@code enum}
199         *      constant.
200         *  @param  args    The arguments for the Javadoc for this {@code enum}
201         *      constant.
202         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
203         */
204        public Builder addEnumConstant( final CharSequence name, final String format, final Object... args );
205
206        /**
207         *  Adds an {@code enum} constant for the type to build.
208         *
209         *  @param  name    The name for the {@code enum} constant.
210         *  @param  typeSpec    The type of the {@code enum} constant.
211         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
212         */
213        public Builder addEnumConstant( final CharSequence name, final TypeSpec typeSpec );
214
215        /**
216         *  Adds a field to this type.
217         *
218         *  @param  fieldSpec   The field definition.
219         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
220         */
221        public Builder addField( final FieldSpec fieldSpec );
222
223        /**
224         *  Adds a field to this type.
225         *
226         *  @param  type    The type of the field.
227         *  @param  name    The name of the field.
228         *  @param  modifiers   The modifiers.
229         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
230         */
231        public Builder addField( final Type type, final CharSequence name, final Modifier... modifiers );
232
233        /**
234         *  Adds a field to this type.
235         *
236         *  @param  type    The type of the field.
237         *  @param  name    The name of the field.
238         *  @param  modifiers   The modifiers.
239         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
240         */
241        public Builder addField( final TypeName type, final CharSequence name, final Modifier... modifiers );
242
243        /**
244         *  Adds fields to this type.
245         *
246         *  @param  fieldSpecs  The fields.
247         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
248         */
249        public Builder addFields( final Iterable<? extends FieldSpec> fieldSpecs );
250
251        /**
252         *  Adds code to the initializer block.
253         *
254         *  @param  block   The code.
255         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
256         */
257        public Builder addInitializerBlock( final CodeBlock block );
258
259        /**
260         *  Adds text to the Javadoc for the type.
261         *
262         *  @param  block   The comment text.
263         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
264         */
265        public Builder addJavadoc( final CodeBlock block );
266
267        /**
268         *  Adds text to the Javadoc for the type.
269         *
270         *  @param  format  The format.
271         *  @param  args    The arguments.
272         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
273         */
274        public Builder addJavadoc( final String format, final Object... args );
275
276        /**
277         *  Adds a method for the type.
278         *
279         *  @param  methodSpec  The method.
280         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
281         */
282        public Builder addMethod( final MethodSpec methodSpec );
283
284        /**
285         *  Adds methods for the type.
286         *
287         *  @param  methodSpecs The methods.
288         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
289         */
290        public Builder addMethods( final Iterable<MethodSpec> methodSpecs );
291
292        /**
293         *  Adds modifiers for the type.
294         *
295         *  @param  modifiers   The modifiers.
296         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
297         */
298        public Builder addModifiers( final Modifier... modifiers );
299
300        /**
301         *  Adds an originating element for the type.
302         *
303         *  @param  originatingElement  The originating element.
304         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
305         */
306        public Builder addOriginatingElement( final Element originatingElement );
307
308        /**
309         *  <p>{@summary Adds a JavaBean property to this type.}</p>
310         *  <p>A property is basically a field with the related getter and
311         *  setter methods.</p>
312         *  <p>If the name for a non-final property will be {@code text}, and
313         *  its type is {@code java.lang.String}, the generated code will look
314         *  basically like this:</p>
315         *  <pre><code>  …
316         *  private String m_Text;
317         *  …
318         *  public final String getText() { return m_Text; }
319         *  …
320         *  public final void setText( final String value ) { m_Text = text; }
321         *  …</code></pre>
322         *  <p>If getter or setter needs to be more complex, the respective
323         *  methods must be created manually.</p>
324         *
325         *  @note The name of the setter parameter is always {@code value}; if
326         *      this is also the name of the field, the generated code will not
327         *      compile. In this case, the setter has to be generated
328         *      manually, too.
329         *
330         *  @param  fieldSpec   The field definition.
331         *  @param  readOnly    {@code true} if no setter should be created
332         *      even for a non-final field, {@code false} if a setter has to be
333         *      created for a non-final field. Will ignored if the field is
334         *      final.
335         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
336         */
337        public Builder addProperty( final FieldSpec fieldSpec, boolean readOnly );
338
339        /**
340         *  Adds a static block for the type.
341         *
342         *  @param  block   The code for the static block.
343         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
344         */
345        public Builder addStaticBlock( final CodeBlock block );
346
347        /**
348         *  Adds a static import.
349         *
350         *  @param  clazz   The class.
351         *  @param  names   The names of the elements from the given class that
352         *      are to be imported.
353         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
354         *
355         *  @since 0.2.0
356         */
357        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
358        public Builder addStaticImport( final Class<?> clazz, final String... names );
359
360        /**
361         *  Adds a static import.
362         *
363         *  @param  className   The class.
364         *  @param  names   The names of the elements from the given class that
365         *      are to be imported.
366         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
367         *
368         *  @since 0.2.0
369         */
370        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
371        public Builder addStaticImport( final ClassName className, final String... names );
372
373        /**
374         *  Adds a static import for the given {@code enum} value.
375         *
376         *  @param  constant    The {@code enum} value.
377         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
378         *
379         *  @since 0.2.0
380         */
381        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
382        public Builder addStaticImport( final Enum<?> constant );
383
384        /**
385         *  <p>{@summary Adds a super interface for the type.} This interface
386         *  is implemented by the new type if that is a {@code class}, or
387         *  extended, if the new type is an {@code interface}.</p>
388         *
389         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a
390         *  superinterface.
391         *
392         *  @param  superinterface  The super interface.
393         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
394         */
395        public Builder addSuperinterface( final Class<?> superinterface );
396
397        /**
398         *  <p>{@summary Adds a super interface for the type.} This interface
399         *  is implemented by the new type if that is a {@code class}, or
400         *  extended, if the new type is an {@code interface}.</p>
401         *
402         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a
403         *  superinterface.
404         *
405         *  @param  superinterface  The super interface.
406         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
407         */
408        public Builder addSuperinterface( final Type superinterface );
409
410        /**
411         *  <p>{@summary Adds a super interface for the type.} This interface
412         *  is implemented by the new type if that is a {@code class}, or
413         *  extended, if the new type is an {@code interface}.</p>
414         *
415         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a
416         *  superinterface.
417         *
418         *  @param  superinterface  The super interface.
419         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
420         */
421        public Builder addSuperinterface( final TypeElement superinterface );
422
423        /**
424         *  <p>{@summary Adds a super interface for the type.} This interface
425         *  is implemented by the new type if that is a {@code class}, or
426         *  extended, if the new type is an {@code interface}.</p>
427         *
428         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a
429         *  superinterface.
430         *
431         *  @param  superinterface  The super interface.
432         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
433         */
434        public Builder addSuperinterface( final TypeName superinterface );
435
436        /**
437         *  <p>{@summary Adds super interfaces for the type.} These interfaces
438         *  are implemented by the new type if that is a {@code class}, or
439         *  extended, if the new type is an {@code interface}.</p>
440         *
441         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a
442         *  superinterface.
443         *
444         *  @param  superinterfaces The super interfaces.
445         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
446         */
447        public Builder addSuperinterfaces( final Iterable<? extends TypeName> superinterfaces );
448
449        /**
450         *  <p>{@summary Adds a suppressable warning for the type.} These will
451         *  result in adding the annotation
452         *  {@link SuppressWarnings &#64;SuppressWarnings}
453         *  to the class.</p>
454         *
455         *  @param  warnings    The warnings to add.
456         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
457         */
458        public Builder addSuppressableWarning( final SuppressableWarnings... warnings );
459
460        /**
461         *  Adds an inner class for the type.
462         *
463         *  @param  typeSpec    The embedded type.
464         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
465         */
466        public Builder addType( final TypeSpec typeSpec );
467
468        /**
469         *  Adds inner classes for the type.
470         *
471         *  @param  typeSpecs   The embedded types.
472         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
473         */
474        public Builder addTypes( final Iterable<? extends TypeSpec> typeSpecs );
475
476        /**
477         *  Adds a type variable for the type.
478         *
479         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a type
480         *  variable without a JavaDoc comment.
481         *
482         *  @param  typeVariable    The type variable.
483         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
484         */
485        public Builder addTypeVariable( final TypeVariableName typeVariable );
486
487        /**
488         *  Adds a type variable for the type together with the respective
489         *  Javadoc.
490         *
491         *  @param  typeVariable    The type variable.
492         *  @param  javadoc The Javadoc comment; this is only the text for the
493         *      comment.
494         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
495         *
496         *  @since  0.2.0
497         */
498        @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
499        public Builder addTypeVariable( final TypeVariableName typeVariable, final CharSequence javadoc );
500
501        /**
502         *  Adds type variables for the type.
503         *
504         *  @note No debug information can be added when adding a type
505         *  variable without a JavaDoc comment.
506         *
507         *  @param  typeVariables   The type variables.
508         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
509         */
510        public Builder addTypeVariables( final Iterable<TypeVariableName> typeVariables );
511
512        /**
513         *  Builds a new
514         *  {@link TypeSpec}
515         *  instance from the added components.
516         *
517         *  @return The new {@code TypeSpec} instance.
518         */
519        public TypeSpec build();
520
521        /**
522         *  <p>{@summary Sets the superclass for the type.} This class is
523         *  extended by the new type.</p>
524         *
525         *  @param  superclass  The superclass.
526         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
527         */
528        public Builder superclass( final Type superclass );
529
530        /**
531         *  <p>{@summary Sets the superclass for the type.} This class is
532         *  extended by the new type.</p>
533         *
534         *  @param  superclass  The superclass.
535         *  @return This {@code Builder} instance.
536         */
537        public Builder superclass( final TypeName superclass );
538    }
539    //  interface Builder
540
541        /*---------*\
542    ====** Methods **==========================================================
543        \*---------*/
544    /**
545     *  {@inheritDoc}
546     */
547    @Override
548    public boolean equals( final Object o );
549
550    /**
551     *  {@inheritDoc}
552     */
553    @Override
554    public int hashCode();
555
556    /**
557     *  Checks whether the given modifier was applied to this type.
558     *
559     *  @param  modifier    The modifier.
560     *  @return {@code true} if the given modifier has been applied to this
561     *      type, {@code false} otherwise.
562     */
563    public boolean hasModifier( final Modifier modifier );
564
565    /**
566     *  Returns the inner types for this type.
567     *
568     *  @return The inner types.
569     */
570    public List<TypeSpec> innerClasses();
571
572    /**
573     *  Returns the name of the class, interface or enum represented by this
574     *  type spec instance.
575     *
576     *  @return An instance of
577     *      {@link Optional}
578     *      that holds the name.
579     */
580    public Optional<String> name();
581
582    /**
583     *  Returns the originating elements for this type.
584     *
585     *  @return The originating elements.
586     */
587    public List<Element> originatingElements();
588
589    /**
590     *  Returns a new builder that is initialised with this {@code TypeSpec}
591     *  instance.
592     *
593     *  @return The new builder.
594     */
595    public Builder toBuilder();
596
597    /**
598     *  {@inheritDoc}
599     */
600    @Override
601    public String toString();
602}
603//  interface TypeSpec
604
605/*
606 *  End of File
607 */
